top_categories.workout_context: Hell of Hunterdon rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Hell of Hunterdon. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Hell of Hunterdon when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Hell of Hunterdon’s new jersey rolling hills, rural gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Hell of Hunterdon isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Hell of Hunterdon’s new jersey rolling hills gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Hell of Hunterdon’s new jersey rolling hills gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Hell of Hunterdon — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
The varied gradients at Hell of Hunterdon reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Hell of Hunterdon — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Hell of Hunterdon’s new jersey rolling hills gravel delivers on race day.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Hell of Hunterdon. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on new jersey rolling hills gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Hell of Hunterdon’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Hell of Hunterdon requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on new jersey rolling hills gravel to build confidence. Expect: new jersey rolling hills, rural gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, G Spot, and Over Under to prepare you for 75 miles of new jersey rolling hills gravel in Hunterdon County, New Jersey.
